Class HNode

java.lang.Object
huffman.HNode
public class HNode extends Object
Represents a node in a Huffman Tree. A node can be either a leaf (holding a single symbol) or an internal parent node (holding combined symbols from its children).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    HNode(char c, int f)
    Constructs a leaf node with a single character and its frequency.
    HNode(HNode left, HNode right)
    Constructs an internal parent node by combining two child nodes.

  • Constructor Details

    • HNode

      public HNode(char c, int f)
      Constructs a leaf node with a single character and its frequency.
      Parameters:
      c - the character stored in this leaf node
      f - the frequency of the character

    • HNode

      public HNode(HNode left, HNode right)
      Constructs an internal parent node by combining two child nodes. The symbols and frequency are the sum of the children's symbols and frequencies.
      Parameters:
      left - the left child node
      right - the right child node

  • Method Details

    • getLeft

      public HNode getLeft()
      Returns the left child of this node.
      Returns:
      the left child node, or null if this is a leaf

    • getRight

      public HNode getRight()
      Returns the right child of this node.
      Returns:
      the right child node, or null if this is a leaf

    • getSymbols

      public String getSymbols()
      Returns the symbols stored in this node.
      Returns:
      the symbols as a string

    • getFrequency

      public int getFrequency()
      Returns the cumulative frequency of symbols in this node.
      Returns:
      the frequency

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      Checks if this node is a leaf node (has no children).
      Returns:
      true if leaf node, false otherwise

    • contains

      public boolean contains(char ch)
      Checks if this node contains a specific character.
      Parameters:
      ch - the character to check
      Returns:
      true if the character exists in this node's symbols

    • getSymbol

      public char getSymbol()
      Returns the symbol of this node if it is a leaf.
      Returns:
      the single character if leaf, or '\0' if not a leaf

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this node in the format: symbols:frequency
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representing the node
